Name: ApiGatewayMethod
Documentation: The AWS::ApiGateway::Method resource creates Amazon API Gateway (API Gateway) methods that define the parameters and body that clients must send in their requests.

Parameters.Name: ApiKeyRequired
Parameters.Documentation: Indicates whether the method requires clients to submit a valid API key.

Parameters.Name: AuthorizerId
Parameters.Documentation: The identifier of the authorizer to use on this method. If you specify this property, specify CUSTOM for the AuthorizationType property.

Parameters.Name: HttpMethod
Parameters.Documentation: The HTTP method that clients will use to call this method.

Parameters.Name: Integration
Parameters.Documentation: The back-end system that the method calls when it receives a request.

Parameters.Name: MethodResponses
Parameters.Documentation: The responses that can be sent to the client who calls the method.

Parameters.Name: RequestModels
Parameters.Documentation: The resources used for the response's content type. Specify response models as key-value pairs (string-to-string map), with a content type as the key and a Model resource name as the value.

Parameters.Name: RequestParameters
Parameters.Documentation: Request parameters that API Gateway accepts. Specify request parameters as key-value pairs (string-to-Boolean map), with a source as the key and a Boolean as the value. The Boolean specifies whether a parameter is required. A source must match the following format method.request.location.name, where the location is querystring, path, or header, and name is a valid, unique parameter name.

Parameters.Name: ResourceId
Parameters.Documentation: The ID of an API Gateway resource. For root resource methods, specify the RestApi root resource ID, such as { "Fn::GetAtt": ["MyRestApi", "RootResourceId"] }.

Parameters.Name: RestApiId
Parameters.Documentation: The ID of the RestApi resource in which API Gateway creates the method.
